intro: Scutellaria transitra var. pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
